member.name: WSL_DISTRIBUTION_FLAGS
member.summary: The WSL_DISTRIBUTION_FLAGS enumeration specifies the behavior of a distribution in the Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL).

member.name: WSL_DISTRIBUTION_FLAGS.WSL_DISTRIBUTION_FLAGS_ENABLE_INTEROP
member.summary: Allow the distribution to interoperate with Windows processes (for example, the user can invoke "cmd.exe" or "notepad.exe" from within a WSL session).

member.name: WSL_DISTRIBUTION_FLAGS.WSL_DISTRIBUTION_FLAGS_APPEND_NT_PATH
member.summary: Add the Windows %PATH% environment variable values to WSL sessions.

member.name: WSL_DISTRIBUTION_FLAGS.WSL_DISTRIBUTION_FLAGS_ENABLE_DRIVE_MOUNTING
member.summary: Automatically mount Windows drives inside of WSL sessions (for example, "C:" will be available under "/mnt/c").
